me.nimnon.nmengine

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.nimnon.nmengine.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The heart of all NmEngine games, this handles the window and state, this class should be instanced to create a game.
    Author:
    Nimnon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Creates empty game window of a blank state
      Game(int width, int height)
      Creates game window of specified width and height.
      Game(int width, int height, java.lang.String title)
      Creates game window of specified width, height and title.
      Game(int width, int height, java.lang.String title, State state)
      Creates a new game with specified width, height, title, and state, the background color is white

      Creates a new Game class, it is advised you only create one of these, else weird things happen.

      Creates a new Game class, it is advised you only create one of these, else weird things happen.
      Game(java.lang.String title, State state)
      Creates a 400x300px window with the specified state and title

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int width,
            int height,
            java.lang.String title,
            State state,
            int tps,
            double zoom,
            java.awt.Color backgroundColor)
        Creates a new Game class, it is advised you only create one of these, else weird things happen.
        Parameters:
        width - Game width in pixels
        height - Game height in pixels
        title - Window title
        state - Game starting state, if null is treated as a new State()
        tps - Ticks per second, how many times a second the update method is called.
        zoom - Zoom of the initial main camera object
        backgroundColor - Background color of the application.

      • Game

        public Game(int width,
            int height,
            java.lang.String title,
            State state,
            int tps,
            java.awt.Color backgroundColor)
        Creates a new Game class, it is advised you only create one of these, else weird things happen.
        Parameters:
        width - Game width in pixels
        height - Game height in pixels
        title - Window title
        state - Game starting state, if null is treated as a new State()
        tps - Ticks per second, how many times a second the update method is called.
        backgroundColor - Background color of the application.

      • switchState

        public static void switchState(State state)
        Switch from current state to a new state
        Parameters:
        state - Which state to switch to. null will be treated as a new State()
